page.title: 19LOCAL HISTORY - FORRES EAST
page.content: {THE WITCHES' STONE The witches' stone is almost a metre and slightly more than a metre in diameter. It is situated in the eastern half of Forres just outside the Police Station and beside the A96. In the old days so-called witches were rolled down {Cluny Hill}in barrels. The stone marks the place where one of those barrels stopped rolling. After the witch had been rolled down the hill she was then burnt at the stake. Orginally there were 3 stones but two have disappeared without trace. This particular stone is supposed to have been split in 3 and used as building material in a nearby house. However when the occupants of the house fell ill with fever the house was said to be bewitched and was demolished.The stone was clasped together & returned.
